qas.question: The structure of Bern's city centre is mainly what type of buildings?
What does UNESCO recognised Bern's city center to be?
What is Berns most famous site?
What is the name of the 15th century cathedral?
What type of cathedral is Muster?

context: The structure of Bern's city centre is largely <a0_0>medieval<a0_0/> and has been recognised by UNESCO as <a1_0>a Cultural World Heritage Site<a1_0/>. Perhaps its most famous sight is the <a2_0>Zytglogge<a2_0/> (Bernese German for "Time Bell"), an elaborate medieval clock tower with moving puppets. It also has an impressive 15th century <a4_0>Gothic<a4_0/> cathedral, the <a3_0>Münster<a3_0/>, and a 15th-century town hall. Thanks to 6 kilometres (4 miles) of arcades, the old town boasts one of the longest covered shopping promenades in Europe.
